alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Wake (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 1:44PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wake and southwestern Franklin Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Wake Forest, or 8 miles northeast of Raleigh, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Raleigh, Wake Forest, Zebulon, Knightdale, Wendell, Rolesville, Youngsville, Pilot and Falls Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
